00014  *                              - pthread library    (usually available on most Linux distros)

00052 typedef enum _CMDLINE_ERRORS {
00053 
00054         CMDLINE_OK = 0,
00055         CMDLINE_MISSING_ARGUMENTS,
00056         CMDLINE_MISSING_PORT,
00057         CMDLINE_MISSING_COOKIE,
00058         CMDLINE_INVALID_COMMAND,
00059         CMDLINE_INVALID_PORT,
00060         CMDLINE_INVALID_COOKIE,
00061 
00062 } CmdLineError;

00078 int main(int argc, char **argv) {
00079 
00080         int result;
00081         int port=0;
00082         char *cookie, *command;
00083 
00084 
00085         result = getOptionsAndCommand(argc, argv, &port, &cookie, &command);
00086         if (0!=result) {
00087                 return 1;
00088         }
00089 
00090         DEBUG_MSG("DEBUG: port    [%u]\n", port);
00091         DEBUG_MSG("DEBUG: cookie  [%s]\n", cookie);
00092         DEBUG_MSG("DEBUG: command [%s]\n", command);
00093 
00094         result = daemon_validate_command(command);
00095         if (0!=result) {
00096                 showMessage( MSG_INVALID_COMMAND );
00097                 return 1;
00098         }
00099 
00100         // if we have a ``start`` command, we need parameters:
00101         if (daemon_is_start_command(command)) {
00102                 result = validatePortCookie(port, cookie);
00103                 if (0!=result) {
00104                         return 1;
00105                 }
00106         }
00107 
00108 
00109         //  DAEMON
00110         // *!*!*!*!
00111         DaemonErrorCode dcode = daemon_handle_command("phidgetmanager", command);
00112 
00113         doLog(LOG_INFO, "daemon_handle_command: dcode[%i]", dcode );
00114 
00115         // should we exit right now?
00116         if (DAEMON_CODE_EXITING == dcode) {
00117                 return 1;
00118         }
00119 
00120         // the command was most probably a ``start``
00121         //  but there was an error...
00122         if (DAEMON_CODE_WRITING_PID_FILE == dcode) {
00123                 doLog(LOG_ERR, "cannot write to pid file. Maybe you are trying to execute proper rights?");
00124                 return 1;
00125         }
00126 
00127         if (DAEMON_CODE_OK != dcode) {
00128                 handleDaemonErrorCode( dcode );
00129                 return 1;
00130         }
00131 
00132 
00133 
00134         // *!*!*!*!* START SUCCESSFUL !@!@!@@!@!!@!!
00135         // =========================================
00136 
00137 
00138         // before any threads are started...
00139         signals_init();
00140 
00141 
00142         // open a litm connection for the signals thread
00143         litm_connection *conn;
00144         litm_code code;
00145 
00146         code = litm_connect_ex_wait( &conn, LITM_ID_MAIN, 0 );
00147 
00148         // pass along the connection parameters
00149         if (LITM_CODE_OK != code ) {
00150                 showMessage(MSG_LITM_CONNECTION_ERROR);
00151                 doLog(LOG_ERR, "main: cannot connect to LITM");
00152                 return 1;
00153         }
00154 
00155 
00156         code = litm_subscribe( conn, LITM_BUS_SYSTEM );
00157         if (LITM_CODE_OK != code ) {
00158                 showMessage(MSG_LITM_SUBSCRIBE_ERROR);
00159                 doLog(LOG_ERR, "main: cannot subscribe to LITM");
00160                 return 1;
00161         }
00162 
00163 
00164 
00165 
00166         int sresult = stimer_init();
00167         doLog(LOG_DEBUG,"stimer, result[%i] errno[%i]", sresult, errno);
00168 
00169 
00170         messages_init();
00171 
00172         manager_init();
00173 
00174         /*
00175          *  COMMUNICATIONS
00176          *  ==============
00177          *
00178          *  PhidgetManager  < -- > Erlang Cnode
00179          */
00180 
00181         //{
00182 
00183 
00184 
00185 
00186         //{
00187         /*
00188         server_params params;
00189 
00190         params.port   = port;
00191         params.cookie = cookie;
00192 
00193         server_init( &params );
00194         */
00195         //}
00196 
00197 
00198         doLog(LOG_INFO, "main: STARTING loop, pid[%u]", getpid() );
00199 
00200         litm_envelope *e;
00201         bus_message  *msg;
00202         bus_message_type type;
00203 
00204         while(1) {
00205 
00206                 code = litm_receive_wait( conn, &e );
00207                 if (LITM_CODE_OK==code) {
00208 
00209                         doLog(LOG_INFO, "main: RX message");
00210 
00211                         //we just respond to shutdown here
00212                         msg = litm_get_message( e );
00213                         if (NULL!=msg) {
00214                                 type = msg->type;
00215 
00216                                 litm_release( conn, e );
00217 
00218                                 if (MESSAGE_SHUTDOWN==type) {
00219                                         break;
00220                                 }
00221                         }
00222                 }
00223 
00224         }
00225 
00226         litm_wait_shutdown();
00227 
00228         doLog(LOG_INFO, "main: END thread");
00229 
00230         return 0;
00231 
00232 }//[/main]

00236 /*
00237  * Displays on stdout a help message
00238  */
00239 void showHelp(int msg_id) {
00240 
00241         const char msg[] = "\
00242 \n Erlang Node Server to Phidget Manager\
00243 \n\
00244 \nUsage:\
00245 \n======\
00246 \n       phidget_erl_manager PORT COOKIE\
00247 \n\n";
00248 
00249         printf( "%s", msg );
00250 
00251         printf( "%s", main_messages[msg_id] );
00252 
00253 }//[/showHelp]
00254

00256 /**
00257  * Show message
00258  */
00259 void showMessage(int msg_id) {
00260 
00261         printf( "%s", main_messages[msg_id] );
00262 
00263 }// showMessage
00264 
00265 void showMessageEx(int msg_id, ...) {
00266 
00267         int _MAX_SIZE = 1024;
00268         int n;
00269 
00270         char *msg_format = main_messages[msg_id];
00271         char *msg_args;
00272 
00273         // if we fail for that small buffer,
00274         //  then the system as a much bigger problem ;-)
00275         msg_args = malloc( _MAX_SIZE * sizeof(char) );
00276         va_list ap;
00277 
00278         va_start(ap, msg_id);
00279                 n = vsnprintf(msg_args, _MAX_SIZE, msg_format, ap);
00280         va_end(ap);
00281 
00282         printf( "%s", msg_args );
00283 }// showMessageEx

00286 /**
00287  * Retrieves the options and the command
00288  *  from the command line
00289  *
00290  */
00291 int getOptionsAndCommand(int argc, char **argv, int *port, char **cookie, char **command) {
00292 
00293         //worst case
00294         *port = 0;
00295         *cookie = NULL;
00296         *command = NULL;
00297 
00298         int c;
00299         char _current_option = ' ';
00300         int  _options_scanning=0;
00301 
00302         opterr = 0;
00303 
00304         while ((c = getopt (argc, argv, "p:c:")) != -1)
00305            switch (c)   {
00306            case 'p':
00307                    if (NULL!=optarg)
00308                            *port = atoi( optarg );
00309                    break;
00310            case 'c':
00311                    if (NULL!=optarg)
00312                            *cookie = optarg;
00313                    break;
00314            case '?':
00315                    _options_scanning = -1; //error
00316                    _current_option = optopt;
00317                    break;
00318            default:
00319                    abort();
00320            }
00321 
00322         if (0!=_options_scanning) {
00323                 if (('p' == _current_option) || ('c' == _current_option)) {
00324                         showMessageEx( MSG_MISSING_OPTION_ARGUMENT, _current_option);
00325                 } else {
00326                         showMessageEx( MSG_INVALID_OPTION, _current_option );
00327                 }
00328                 return 1;
00329         }
00330 
00331         if ((optind > 0) && (optind<argc)) {
00332                 *command = argv[optind];
00333         } else {
00334                 showMessage( MSG_INVALID_COMMAND );
00335                 return 1;
00336         }
00337 
00338 
00339         return 0; // OK
00340 }//getOptionsAndCommand
00341 
00342 /**
00343  * Crude validation of parameters
00344  */
00345 int validatePortCookie(int port, char *cookie) {
00346 
00347         if (0 == port) {
00348                 showHelp( MSG_PORT_INTEGER );
00349                 return 1;
00350         }
00351 
00352         // validate (somewhat) cookie parameter
00353         if (NULL==cookie) {
00354                 showHelp( MSG_COOKIE_STRING );
00355                 return 1;
00356         }
00357 
00358         return 0;
00359 }
00360 
00361 /**
00362  *  Prints an error message
00363  */
00364 void handleDaemonErrorCode(DaemonErrorCode code) {
00365 
00366         int msg_id = codeToMsg( code );
00367         showMessage( msg_id );
00368 
00369 }// handleDaemonErrorCode
00370 
00371 /**
00372  * TODO handle this mapping more elegantly...
00373  */
00374 int codeToMsg(DaemonErrorCode code) {
00375 
00376         switch(code) {
00377         case DAEMON_CODE_OK:                                    return MSG_OK;
00378         case DAEMON_CODE_NO_PID_FILE:                   return MSG_NO_PID_FILE;
00379         case DAEMON_CODE_INVALID_NAME:                  return MSG_INVALID_NAME;
00380         case DAEMON_CODE_READING_PID_FILE:              return MSG_READING_PID_FILE;
00381         case DAEMON_CODE_INVALID_PID:                   return MSG_INVALID_PID;
00382         case DAEMON_CODE_READING_PROC_CMDLINE:  return MSG_READING_PROC_CMDLINE;
00383         case DAEMON_CODE_PROC_CMDLINE_NOMATCH:  return MSG_CMDLINE_NOMATCH;
00384         case DAEMON_CODE_INVALID_COMMAND:               return MSG_INVALID_COMMAND;
00385         case DAEMON_CODE_KILL_FAILED:                   return MSG_KILL_FAILED;
00386         case DAEMON_CODE_DAEMON_EXIST:                  return MSG_DAEMON_EXIST;
00387         case DAEMON_CODE_WRITING_PID_FILE:              return MSG_WRITING_PID_FILE;
00388         case DAEMON_CODE_EXITING:                               return MSG_OK; //shouldn't need to use this.
00389         }
00390 
00391         return MSG_CODE_NOT_FOUND;
00392 }// codeToMsg
